result.execSummary:
The defendant Eddie Albert Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).
  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge and all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments. To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to a civil judgment upon release from Extended Supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 140 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.  Vocational/educational training.
Mental health assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.
No conact with J.A.B. and S.S., their family, residence or place of employment.

Sex offender assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.
Domestic violence treatment.
Anger management.
Cognitive behavior therapy.
Pay supervision fees.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Random urine screens.  Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay imposed mandatory surcharges.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
The Court informed the defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eddie Albert Gordon in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Eddie Albert Gordon in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections not made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 35 YEARS consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 140 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 20 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 YEARS. 
AS TO COUNT 7:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 20 YEARS consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 10 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS

AS TO EACH COUNT: Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Mental health assesment  and comply with recommended treatment.
*Sex offender assessment and comply with recommended treatment
*Domestic violence treatment
*Anger Management
*Random urine screens.
*Absolute sobriety
*No contact with J.A.B. and S.S. their family, residence or place of employment
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Pay supervision fees.

As to each count: 
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surchages.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge and all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release from extended supervision.  

The Court informed the defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.  

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he/she may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment; 
jad

Defendant Eddie Albert Gordon in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Eddie Albert Gordon in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNTS 2 & 7:  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  On State's motion, Court ordered COUNTS 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8 & 9 DISMISSED AND READ IN.  On motion of defense, Court ordered presentence investigation. Order for presentence investigation filed; copy to Probation Dept.  
Case adjourned to 7-29-2014 for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 10.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms/body armor.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-29-2014 at 08:30 am.

ADA Williams in trial in another court.  Case adjourned to 6-4-2014 at 8:30 a.m. for projected guilty plea in Branch 10.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

State's Motions in Limine filed with:
-State's Witness List.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Eddie Albert Gordon not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 10  Plea hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eddie Albert Gordon in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Eddie Albert Gordon in custody.  Joshua Mathy for Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribedl.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JAB dob 2/16/99; SS dob 12/29/98 and their families; residences; homes or schools
